data.title: Jalalabad, Afghanistan: What to pack, what to wear, and when to go [2024]
data.meta_description:
Traveling to Jalalabad, Afghanistan? If you're planning to go to Jalalabad, 
we've got some important information about when to go, what to wear, and what 
to pack.
data.text:
Empty Lighthouse is a reader-supported site. This article may contain affiliate links to Amazon and other sites. We earn a commission on purchases made through these links.

Ready to pack for Jalalabad, Afghanistan? If you're planning to go to Jalalabad, this article contains some important information about when to go, what to wear, and what to pack.

Contents

When to go to Jalalabad, Afghanistan

Based on the climate and weather in Jalalabad, Afghanistan, the best time to go is October. See below for details.

What to wear/what to pack for Jalalabad, Afghanistan

Already know when you're traveling?

Here are some general tips on what to wear in Jalalabad, as well as several items to remember to pack when traveling there.

What to wear/what to pack for Jalalabad, Afghanistan by month

January

January in Jalalabad is relatively cool. The average overnight temperatures in the area are in the high 30s F (single digits C).

What to wear/what to pack:

Clothes + Footwear

Jacket or coat

for men

for women

for boys

for girls

Warm pants or jeans

for women

for men

Fleece

for men

for women

for boys

for girls

Light gloves or mittens

for men

for women

for kids (extra in case they get lost)

Lip balm

In our opinion, the best choice: this

Extra socks

for men

for women

for boys

for girls

Sneakers or comfortable shoes

for men

for women

for boys

for girls

Health

Virus/bacteria filtering water bottle

Some rural areas may have unreliable tap water, so it's important to bring a contaminant filtering water bottle.

Travel first aid kit

This one is a good value.

Emergency motion sickness relief

Pills

Wristband

Travel disinfecting wipes

Use these to sanitize plane and hotel surfaces.

Hand sanitizer

This hand sanitizer is a good TSA-friendly option.

Safety + Security

Given current world events, Afghanistan has travel concerns that you should consider before going. Click for more information.

Voice and data SIM card

A SIM card that works in Jalalabad. A good global SIM card works in most countries, but check the country list before buying. In some more rural areas you may need a satellite phone. We recommend this satellite phone.

AirTag to track your luggage

With airports repeatedly losing bags nowadays, an AirTag can help you locate it anywhere in the world: AirTag for iPhones.

Anti-theft backpack

For a bit of protection, an anti-theft backpack protects your stuff.

Money/passport pouch

A money pouch is vital for protecting your passport and credit cards.

Comfort + Essentials

Power bank for devices

A portable power bank, like this one

Travel neck support pillow

What we like is this one

Travel voltage adapter

A plug adapter that supports outlet types C and F. Ensure that you get the correct kind. Most adapters on sale are simply plugs and require your electronics to convert the voltage themselves. If your devices can't do that they could get fried. This one works in most places.

Luggage scale to avoid fees

Airlines charge huge penalties for overweight luggage. Avoid surcharges with this

Airplane phone mount

Make your flight more comfortable with an airplane phone mount

February

February in Jalalabad is balmy and very dry with almost no rain. The average overnight temperatures in the area are in the low 40s F (single digits C).

A SIM card that works in Jalalabad. A good global SIM card works in most countries, but check the country list before buying. In some more rural areas you may need a satellite phone. We recommend this satellite phone.

Money/passport pouch

A money pouch is vital for protecting your passport and credit cards.

Comfort + Essentials

Luggage scale to avoid fees

Airlines charge large prices for overweight luggage. Avoid penalties with this

Airplane phone mount

Travel neck support pillow

A top rated pillow is this one

Travel voltage adapter

A plug adapter that supports outlet types C and F. Check that you pick the right type. The vast majority of adapters for sale now are simply plug changers and expect your devices to convert the voltage themselves. If your electronics can't do that they could get fried. This one should be appropriate for most locations.

Power bank for devices

A portable power bank, like this one

March is mild. Temperatures average in the low 70s F (low 20s C) during the day. It rains once in a while.

April in Jalalabad is warm. The rain can amount to several inches/centimeters. During this time, temperatures average in the high 60s F (low 20s C) to low 80s F (high 20s C).

May

If you vacation in Jalalabad during May, you will probably find that it is sweltering and dry with little rain. Temperatures tend to hover around the low 90s F (mid 30s C) during the day, while at night they can dip into the low 60s F (high 10s C).

Clothes + Footwear

Waterproof sandals

What to do in Jalalabad, Afghanistan

Jalalabad, located in eastern Afghanistan, is a city that is rich in history and culture. Although the city has had its share of troubles in recent years, it has emerged as a popular tourist destination. With its picturesque surroundings, historic landmarks, and cultural heritage, Jalalabad has become a must-visit destination for travelers looking to explore Afghanistans vibrant past and present. Here are the top tourist attractions in Jalalabad:

1. Spin Ghar: Spin Ghar, also known as the White Mountains, is an iconic landmark in Jalalabad. It is a mountain range that is located on the border between Pakistan and Afghanistan. The range is 100 miles long and has an average height of 4,000 meters. Spin Ghar is ideal for trekking, climbing, and camping. It also offers some of the most spectacular views in the area, including the famous Gumbad Kala and Darunta Dam.

2. Gumbad Kala: Gumbad Kala is an ancient architectural site that dates back to the 2nd century BC. It is located on the top of a hill and commands a stunning view of the surrounding countryside. The site features the ruins of a Buddhist stupa, fortress walls, and other ancient structures that provide a glimpse into the rich cultural heritage of the region.

3. Afghan-Japan Friendship Hospital: Located in the heart of Jalalabad, the Afghan-Japan Friendship Hospital is a modern medical facility that was built with the assistance of the Japanese government. Operated by Japanese doctors and Afghan medical professionals, the hospital provides quality medical care to patients from all over Afghanistan.

4. Darunta Dam: Darunta Dam is a picturesque dam that is located on the Kabul River, about 10 miles east of Jalalabad. The dam provides water for irrigation, hydroelectric power generation, and other uses. The area around Darunta Dam is ideal for picnics, fishing, and boating, and there are several parks and recreation areas nearby.

5. Mausoleum of King Amanullah: The Mausoleum of King Amanullah is a historic landmark in Jalalabad that is dedicated to the memory of King Amanullah, who ruled Afghanistan from 1919 to 1929. The mausoleum is a beautiful structure that features intricate carvings and designs. It is located in a park-like setting and is surrounded by lush greenery and gardens.

6. Nangarhar Provincial Museum: The Nangarhar Provincial Museum is a fascinating museum that showcases the history and culture of the region. The museum houses a collection of artifacts that date back to the Kushan period, including pottery, coins, and other objects of historical and archaeological significance.

7. Shershah Suri Mosque: The Sher Shah Suri Mosque is a historic mosque that was built in the 16th century. It is an impressive structure that features intricate geometric designs and architectural elements that are characteristic of Mughal-era mosques. The mosque is located in a tranquil setting and is an ideal place for contemplation and prayer.

In conclusion, Jalalabad is a city that is rich in culture and history, and offers a range of attractions for visitors. From ancient architectural sites to modern medical facilities, Jalalabad has something for everyone. Its breathtaking landscapes, historic landmarks, and cultural heritage make it an ideal destination for travelers looking to explore the history and culture of Afghanistan.
